description: Integers > 1 whose prime divisors are all Mersenne primes (i.e. of the form (2^p -1)).
example: 63 is included because the prime factorization of 63 is 3^2 * 7 = (2^2 -1)^2 *(2^3 -1).
prog: (PARI) isok(n) = {if (n==1, return (0)); my(f = factor(n)); for (k=1, #f~, if (! ((q=ispower(f[k, 1]+1,,&e)) && isprime(q) && (e==2)), return(0));); 1;} \\ _Michel Marcus_, Apr 25 2016
author: _Leroy Quet_, Aug 09 2000
extensions: Offset corrected and more terms by _Michel Marcus_, Apr 25 2016
